alert.note: Alert for Niagara; Orleans (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 1:39PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NIAGARA AND ORLEANS COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 135 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hamlin Beach State Park to near Newfane to near Fort Niagara State Park. Movement was east at 10 mph. Storms will continue to train over the same areas, which may produce areas of heavy rainfall and the possibility for some localized flooding. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, torrential rainfall, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lockport, Medina, Albion, Hamlin Beach State Park, Newfane, Lewiston, Youngstown, Middleport, Holley, Waterport, Lakeside Beach State Park, Fort Niagara State Park, Point Breeze, Kent, Ridgeway, Shelby, Gaines, Kendall, Wilson, and Lyndonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
